intro: Bupleurum yokoyamae, commonly known as the Yokoyama's angelica, is a rare flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
